text.section: In this section, "offer for sale" includes to induce, solicit, attempt, or advertise in a manner intended to encourage a person to purchase an identification card.

Subject to subsection (c) of this section, a person may not:
sell, issue, offer for sale, or offer to issue an identification card or document that contains:
a blank space for a person's age or date of birth; or
a person's incorrect age or date of birth; or
knowingly sell, issue, offer for sale, or offer to issue an identification card or document that contains:
an incorrect name instead of a person's true name; or
an incorrect address for a person.

This section does not prohibit a manufacturer of identification cards or documents from selling or issuing identification cards or documents that contain a blank space for a person's age or date of birth to:
employers, for use as employee identification cards or documents;
hospitals, for use as patient identification cards; or
governmental units.

section.section: A person who violates this section is guilty of a misdemeanor and on conviction is subject to imprisonment not exceeding 2 years or a fine not exceeding $2,000 or both.
Each identification card or document sold or issued and each offer in violation of this section is a crime that may be separately prosecuted.

text.section: The Attorney General, or the State's Attorney for a county where a violation of this section occurs, may seek an injunction to stop a sale, issue, or offer that violates this section.
